page.title: 05MADLEY EARTH STATION Pt1
page.content: The world telecomunications network, which speeds facts,figures,pictures and ideas between nations and individuals is one of the most complex machines ever built.Everyday thousands of people use it to speak to someone on the other side of the world. Britains part in the international telecommunications machine is the responsibility of British Telecom which runs Goonhilly and Madley earth stations and provides all the other international and maritime telecommunications services. Two thirds of all intercontinental telephone calls pass through the satelite networks. So do telex, data and facsimile calls, television broadcasts giving world coverage of major events such as the Olympic Games, and even calls to ships at sea.
